content: i highly recommend this as a resource i learned from youtube i strongly suggest using 100% wool or mixed wool merino wool instead of tweed cotton or alpaca - brioche is very stretchy i suggest that you practice this pattern first doing a swatch to get a right gauge and save your time 4 briochestarter hat by raina kruus © 2020 brioche stitch abbreviations brlsl decrease = 2-stitch decrease that slants to the left involving 3 stitches = slip first stitch knitwise brk the bor beginning of the round following two stitches together pass the slipped stitch brk brioche knit also known as a bark = knit stitch over that was slipped in the previous row together with its https //www youtube com/watch v=4ro_n4ncudq& yarn over t=23s brp brioche purl also know as a burp = purl the stitch mc = main color for the front of the work and the knit that was slipped in the previous row together with its stitches i used orange yarn sunset yarn over p = purl pm = place marker sl = slip sm= slip marker helpful tutorial sl1yo following a knit or brk stitch mc round = slip https //www youtube com/watch v=q8de96grbec 1 yarn over = bring the working yarn under the needle cc = contrasting color for the back of the work and to the front of the work slip the next stitch purlwise purl stitches i used petrol blue yarn reflecting pool then bring the yarn over the needle and over the co = cast on lh = left hand rh = right hand round = slipped stitch to the back in position to work the round following stitch this slipped stitch with yarn over is considered 1 stitch only br4st decrease = involving 5 stitches 4 stitch decrease = slip the first and the second stitches separately sl1yo following a purl or brp stitch cc round = slip knitwise place the following stitch on cable needle to 1 over move stitch from cable needle stitch to lh needle place working stitch on lh needle pass st/s = stitch or stitches the stitch from cable needle over and place finished decrease wyif = with yarn
